Compute autocorrelation of single neuron object

compute.autocorr.Rd

This function computes the autocorrelation of a single neuron object using specified parameters. It's a wrapper around the compute_autocorrelation method of the neuron class.

Usage

compute.autocorr(nrn, bin_count_action = "sum", use_raw = TRUE)

Arguments

nrn

Neuron object for which to compute autocorrelation.

bin_count_action

Method for counting spikes in each bin when computing autocorrelation; one of "boolean", "mean", or "sum" (default: "sum").

use_raw

Logical indicating whether to use raw autocorrelation (true) or standard centered and normalized correlation (false) (default: TRUE).

Value

None. Modifies neuron in place.

On this page
